compounddef.title: Quick Start: Building and Running Proto

detaileddescription.para: This guide will walk you through the process of downloading, building, and running the Proto library and its command-line interface.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.para: Before you begin, make sure you have the following tools installed on your system:

listitem.para: A C++20 Compliant Compiler: GCC 10+ or Clang 11+

sect1.title: Building the Library
sect1.para: The build process uses a standard CMake workflow.

listitem.para: Clone the Repository: First, clone the Proto source code from GitHub. sh git clone https://github.com/your-repo/proto.git cd protoCore
Create a Build Directory: It's good practice to build the project in a separate directory. sh mkdir build cd build
Configure with CMake: Run CMake to generate the build files for your system. sh cmake ..
Compile the Code: Finally, run make to compile the library and all associated tools. sh make

sect1.para: If the build is successful, you will find the compiled libproto.a library and the proto executable inside the build/ directory.

sect1.title: Running the Proto Executable
sect1.para: The proto executable is a simple Read-Eval-Print-Loop (REPL) that allows you to interact with the Proto runtime directly. You can run it from the build directory:
You should see a proto> prompt. You can now enter Proto expressions.
